stimulusHtml: Which of the following historical developments most likely contributed to the African American population changes in the North and West shown on the map?

features.html:
• The map shows the following overall trends:

    • Decrease between 0 and 59% throughout the South

    • Decrease between 60 and 99.9% in small pockets throughout the Midwest

    • Increase between 0 and 59% along the southeast coast

    • Increase of 60% and over throughout much of the Northeast, West, and Southwest

Library of Congress

choicesHtml: African Americans moved to those regions primarily to seek employment opportunities in wartime industries during World War II.
African Americans moved to those regions primarily because they wanted to participate in the cultural and artistic movements of the Harlem Renaissance.
African Americans moved to those regions primarily because they wanted greater access to education at colleges and universities.
African Americans moved to those regions primarily because they wanted to reconnect with family they lost during slavery.
